description: Protagonist of this game is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artist]artist[/url].
name: Artist Protagonist

description: Protagonist of this game has a tremendous amount of money.
name: Wealthy Protagonist

description: Protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghost]ghost[/url].
name: Ghost Protagonist

description: Protagonist of this game is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Undead]undead[/url].
name: Undead Protagonist

description: Protagonist of this game engages in sexual activities in exchange for money. For details check [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prostitution]prostitution[/url].
name: Prostitute Protagonist

description:
Protagonist of this story is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slave]slave[/url], or becomes one later in the story.

Slavery is a system under which people are treated as property to be bought and sold, and are forced to work. Slaves can be held against their will from the time of their capture, purchase or birth, and deprived of the right to leave, to refuse to work, or to demand compensation.
name: Slave Protagonist

description: There is a rape scene for the protagonist in at least one of the routes and this is unavoidable. Use [url=/g3820]Completely Unavoidable Protagonist Rape[/url] if the rape scenes appear in every route or before the branching point.
name: Unavoidable Protagonist Rape

description: The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priest]priest[/url] or priestess.
name: Priest(ess) Protagonist

description:
A kinetic novel is a VN that does not present the "player" with any choices at all; they simply read through a single unbranching story.

The term originates from Visual Art's brand KineticNovel (and all games produced under that brand are examples of this), but it is now also used to describe games by other companies with a similar structure.
name: Kinetic Novel

description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friendship]Friendship[/url] is an important theme in this story. It may be about a group of friends that have always been together, and how their relations change as they grow up. Or it may be a story about how the friendship between two people stands against all odds.

Examples are limitless, but take care to use this tag only for games that 'friendship' is one of the key elements for the story, otherwise every game has 'friends'.
name: Friendship

description: Protagonist of this game is (or was) an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassin]assassin[/url].
name: Assassin Protagonist

description:
Protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salaryman]white-collar businessman[/url].

Salaryman refers to someone whose income is salary based; particularly those working for corporations.
name: Salaryman Protagonist

description:
The protagonist of this game acts stupid, but its all an act on his part.

Also sometimes known as "playing dumb", a tactic whose effectiveness is predicated on characters convincing others they are complete oafs and therefore harmless.

See [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObfuscatingStupidity]this[/url] for more info.
name: Protagonist that's Feigning Idiocy

description:
This game has considerable number of Japanese-specific puns generally referring to the design, etymology, radical composition etc. of kanji.

The puns may be made as a joke for comedy reasons, or they may serve a plot point.
name: Kanji Puns

description:
The game is set in, or at least has considerable time of its story taking place in modern day [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihabara]Akihabara[/url].
Note: "Modern day" refers to an unspecified time period between the late 20th century and today.
name: Modern Day Akihabara

description:
The visual novel features at least one sex-scene involving [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominatrix]female domination[/url].

Female domination is a BDSM activity in which the dominant partner is female.
name: Female Domination

description:
One of the heroine of this game displays no emotion, animation, or expression whenever she talks or does anything else.

Heroines which have this personality usually are suffering from some sort of psychological trauma.
name: Emotionless Heroine

description: This story features multiple scenes involving sexual devices or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_toys]sex toys[/url].
name: Sexual Devices

description: This story features multiple scenes involving the use of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vibrator_(sex_toy)]vibrators[/url].
name: Vibrators

description: This story features multiple scenes involving [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dildo]dildos[/url].
name: Dildos

description: This story features multiple scenes involving [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strap-on_dildo]strap-on dildos[/url].
name: Strap-on Dildos

description:
One or more heroines in this game are [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/clumsy]clumsy[/url] or known to be [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accident-proneness]prone to accidents[/url].

A clumsy person is someone lacking in skill or physical coordination, who tends to be prone to more accidents then others.

Accident-proneness, also known as clumsiness, is the conception that some people might have predisposition, or that they might be more likely to suffer accidents, such as car crashes and industrial injuries, than other people. It may be used as a reason to deny any insurance on such individuals.
name: Clumsy Heroine

description: This story features scenes where a character uses or is forced/tricked into using a vibrator in secret during every day activities, for example while at work, at school, eating dinner, etc.
name: Hidden Vibrator

description:
This game's protagonist has a face that is visible in CGs and/or [URL=https://vndb.org/g1903]on their sprite(s)[/URL].

This is a notable difference from the usual VN protagonist with a hidden face- protagonists with hidden faces usually have their hair or a shadow covering their face, their face being barely out of screen on every shot, their eyes not drawn, etc.
name: Protagonist with a Face

description: This story features the use of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Condom]condoms[/url].
name: Condoms

description: This story features the use of a vibrator that can be controlled remotely.
name: Remote-controlled Vibrator

description: This game has one or more scenes of losing one's virginity or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defloration#Loss_of_virginity]defloration[/url]. Usually includes blood and long winded discussions about it.
name: Defloration

description: During some part of this game the protagonist is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impotent]impotent[/url].
name: Impotent Protagonist

description: This story features some sexual acts taking place in a public location, i.e. park, train, school, etc.
name: Sex in Public Places

description: This story has sexual scenes involving females in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menstruation]menstruation[/url].
name: Sex Involving Menstruation

description: The speaking character's portrait is included at the side of the text box, possibly in addition to an already shown sprite.
name: Side Portraits

description: This tag is used on stories where one or more male characters sexually assault another male.
name: Male on Male Rape

description:
This story takes place at a time between years 1901-2000 on Earth.

More details on [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/20th_century]20th Century[/url] can be found on wikipedia.
name: 20th Century

description:
This story takes place at a time between years 1970-1979 on Earth.

More details on [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/70%27s]70's[/url] can be found on wikipedia.
name: 70's

description:
This story takes place at a time between years 1980-1989 on Earth.

More details on [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1980s]80's[/url] can be found on wikipedia.
name: 80's

description: This story has many scenes set in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel]hotel[/url].
name: Hotel

description: This game has more heroines than the usual visual novels; at least eight to be specific.
name: More Than Seven Heroines

description:
Protagonist is an airhead.

Airheads lack common sense, but have a happy and friendly attitude.
name: Airhead Protagonist

description: This game contains sexual acts involving corpses, called [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Necrophilia]necrophilia[/url].
name: Necrophilia

description: This game features at least one sex scene containing a character being anally penetrated in some way.
name: Anal Penetration

description:
One of the characters in this game is the recipient of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footjob]footjob[/url].

A footjob refers to sexual practice with the feet. It is considered part of foot fetishism. Related activities include toejob, focusing on the toes, and solejob, using only the foot soles.
name: Footjob

description:
The game contains at least one scene that features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titfuck]titty fucking[/url].

A boobjob involves the stimulation of the male penis by the female breasts.
name: Boobjob

description:
This game contains [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Furry]Furry[/url] characters.

Furry is a slang describing characters that have animal like appearances but walk on two legs and act like humans.

While it is easy to mix this tag with [url=http://vndb.org/g753]Kemonomimi[/url], this [url=http://th00.deviantart.net/fs70/PRE/f/2011/328/9/7/furry_chart_by_mandalorianjedi-d4h6t0n.jpg]picture[/url] might help solve the puzzle.
name: Furry

description: These games feature [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kemonomimi#Animals]kemonomimi[/url] characters, who typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities (such as ears or tails).
name: Kemonomimi

description: This meta tag is to gather character tags that don't specifically apply to a protagonist, heroine or a support character at this level.
name: Misc. Character Tags

description: The plot revolves around [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence]artificial intelligences[/url] at least to some degree and ponders their true nature.
name: Artificial Intelligence

description:
All the heroines, i.e, those that have routes, in this game are virgins.

This [url=http://virgindb.g.ribbon.to/]site[/url] might help.
name: Only Virgin Heroines

description: The game has many scenes taking place during [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter]Winter[/url].
name: Winter

description: This meta-tag is to gather the four season tags for games that take place in a specific one (or more), capture that season's mood, etc.
name: Seasons

description: The game has many scenes taking place during Summer.
name: Summer

description:
One or more heroines in this game pilots/drives/wears? a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha]mecha[/url].

Includes all kinds of sci-fi & fantasy situations like transforming into a mecha, remote controlling one by a cyberlink/remote in reality or virtual/fantasy reality etc.
name: Mecha Pilot Heroine

description:
One or more heroines in this game operates a land vehicle.

Includes [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Driving]driving[/url] all kinds of land vehicles from city cars to racing ones to buses, trucks etc. But also includes military vehicles like tanks...

Also includes carts and wagons that are pulled by animals but does not include any others that would be better associated with 'riding' than 'driving' like horses, bikes, skateboards and such.
name: Driver Heroine

description:
Protagonist of this game operates a land vehicle.

Includes [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Driving]driving[/url] all kinds of land vehicles from city cars to racing ones to buses, trucks etc. But also includes military vehicles like tanks...

Also includes carts and wagons that are pulled by animals but does not include any others that would be better associated with 'riding' than 'driving' like horses, bikes, skateboards and such.
name: Driver Protagonist

description:
Protagonist of this game pilots/drives/wears? a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha]mecha[/url].

Includes all kinds of sci-fi & fantasy situations like transforming into a mecha, remote controlling one by a cyberlink/remote in reality or virtual/fantasy reality etc.
name: Mecha Pilot Protagonist

description:
This game has gameplay elements belonging to the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racing_game]racing game[/url] genre.

This tag is for games that has you actively playing those sequences, unlike the first Moero Downhill Night game where all you do in races are making VN-style choices.
name: Racing Game

description: These games features many scenes with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunflower]sunflowers[/url], and/or sunflower fields.
name: Sunflowers

description:
These are the tags that can be best described as [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plot_device]plot devices[/url].

A plot device is an object or character in a story whose sole purpose is to advance the plot of the story, or alternatively to overcome some difficulty in the plot.
name: Plot Devices

description:
Contains one or more animated ending sequences.

Only use for games with ending animations, not the ones that has animated scenes to tell the story.
name: Animated Ending

description: For games that feature a lot of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant]plant[/url] and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flower]flower[/url] related scenes.
name: Plants & Flowers

description: The game features scenes with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose]roses[/url], and/or rose fields.
name: Roses

description: These games are set in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dystopia]dystopia[/url].
name: Dystopia

description:
This story includes a conspiracy.

It can be a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collusion]collusion[/url], [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conspiracy_%28civil%29]civil[/url], [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conspiracy_%28crime%29]criminal[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conspiracy_%28political%29]political conspiracy[/url].
name: Conspiracy

description: These games have a voiced protagonists, but it's not often.
name: Protagonist with Partial Voice Acting

description:
One or more heroines in this game are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orphan]orphans[/url].

An orphan is a child permanently bereaved of or abandoned by his or her parents. In common usage, only a child (or the young of an animal) who has lost both parents is called an orphan. However, adults can also be referred to as orphans, or "adult orphans".
name: Orphan Heroine

description:
One or more heroines in this game is a tactician -a person skilled in designing and planning action and policy to achieve a major or overall aim.

Her actions are calculated, usually thinking outside the box, and employing unorthodox tactics and strategies to achieve her goals.

She might be leader, an advisor, or just someone that's observing and commenting in the sidelines.
name: Tactician Heroine

description:
The protagonist of this game is a tactician -a person skilled in designing and planning action and policy to achieve a major or overall aim.

His actions are calculated, usually thinking outside the box, and employing unorthodox tactics and strategies to achieve his goals.

He might be a leader, an advisor, or just someone that's observing and commenting in the sidelines.
name: Tactician Protagonist

description:
One or more support characters in this game are tacticians - people skilled in designing and planning action and policy to achieve a major or overall aim.

Their actions are calculated, usually thinking outside the box, and employing unorthodox tactics and strategies to achieve their goals.

They might be leaders, advisors, or just someones that's observing and commenting in the sidelines.
name: Tactician Support Character

description:
A technique in which the narrator of the story is not sincere or introduces a bias in the way he tells it and possibly misleads the reader, hiding or minimizing some events, characters or motivations.

See [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unreliable_narrator]Wikipedia[/url] for more info.
name: Unreliable Narrator

description:
An interjected scene that takes the narrative forward in time from the current point of the story. Flashforwards are often used to represent events expected, projected, or imagined to occur in the future. They may also reveal significant parts of the story that has not yet occurred, but soon will in greater detail.

See [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flashforward]wikipedia[/url] for more info.
name: Flashforward

description: A heroine in this story is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheerleader]cheerleader[/url].
name: Cheerleader Heroine

description: These games are made of multiple windows instead of one game window with all the games contents in it. You can move all of these windows around in your desktop and shape your game environment as you like.
name: Separate Windows

description: This story has some of it's characters doing [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosplay]cosplay[/url].
name: Cosplay

description:
A heroine in this story is occasionally [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoking]smoking[/url] some kind of tobacco, cigars or cigarettes.

Please use the [url=http://vndb.org/g165]Drug Use[/url] tag for weed and other similar substances.
name: Smoker Heroine

description:
The protagonist in this story is occasionally [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoking]smoking[/url] some kind of tobacco, cigars or cigarettes.

Please use the [url=http://vndb.org/g165]Drug Use[/url] tag for weed and other similar substances.
name: Smoker Protagonist

description:
This story has elements of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alcoholism]alcoholism[/url].

PS: Don't use it on every game that a person drinks a glass oｒ two...
name: Alcoholism

description:
The protagonist of this story quit school before graduation. Sometimes also used as dropping out of society.

See [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dropping_out]the related Wikipedia entry[/url] for details.
name: Drop-Out Protagonist

description: These eroge contain sex scenes where one of the characters (or the protagonists) has sex with an alternate version of himself/herself.
name: Selfcest

description:
This story has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thriller_(genre)]thriller[/url] elements.

Thriller is a broad genre of literature, film, and television programming that uses suspense, tension and excitement as the main elements. Thrillers heavily stimulate the viewer's moods giving them a high level of anticipation, ultra-heightened expectation, uncertainty, surprise, anxiety and/or terror. Thriller films tend to be adrenaline-rushing, gritty, rousing and fast-paced.
name: Thriller

description:
Yangire  refers to characters who snap suddenly out of jealousy, irritation or something similar. This behavior is different from that of a yandere character in regard to the motivation that sparked the change in the character.

In short, the yanderekko is motivated through her love for the male protagonist, while a yangire character is motivated through other characters and will not be connected with emotions of love or attraction. Like yandere, the related noun yangirekko can be used to describe a female character with a yangire personality trait.

[From [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandere#Yangire]Wikipedia[/url]]
name: Yangire Heroine

description:
Games with this tag don't use sprites to represent their characters. But they may have small character portraits appearing on the side of the text box.

Refer to the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_novel#Style]Wikipedia[/url] entry for more details.
name: No Character Sprites

description:
This game features a side character with a darker [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skin_tone]skin tone[/url].

Can also be used for extremely tanned characters.
name: Dark Skinned Characters

description: These are the tags about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_skin_color]skin colors[/url].
name: Character Skin Colors

description: Games with this tag have a disproportionate amount of event CGs. Can overlap with [url=http://vndb.org/g791]No Character Sprites[/url] if the game uses only CGs and backgrounds to tell its story.
name: Lots of Event CGs

description:
This game features very little to zero number of event CG's.

Please do not mix with Effect CGs, those are the full screen CG images that appear on the screen momentarily to represent an effects.
Some examples for effect CGs are the combat effects in Fate/stay night and the gunshot effects in Umineko no Naku Koro ni.
name: No Event CGs

description: The game has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanomachines]nanomachines[/url] as an important part of the story.
name: Nanomachines

description:
Tags related to games Event CGs go here.

Event CG description from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_novel]Wikipedia[/url]:
In the typical visual novel, the graphics comprise a set of generic backgrounds (normally just one for each location in the game), with character sprites (立ち絵 , tachi-e) superimposed on these; the perspective is usually first-person, with the protagonist remaining unseen. At certain key moments in the plot, special event CG graphics are displayed instead; these are more detailed images, drawn specially for that scene rather than being composed from predefined elements, which often use more cinematic camera angles and include the protagonist. These event CGs can usually be viewed at any time once they have been "unlocked" by finding them in-game; this provides a motivation to replay the game and try making different decisions, as it is normally impossible to view all special events on a single play-through.
name: Event CGs

description:
All kinds of tags related to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_%28computer_graphics%29]sprites[/url] goes here.

When we say 'sprites' while referring to VN's we imagine the 'character sprites'. But actually, everything else on that VN's screen, aside from the background and text, are also sprites.

Character Sprites are called tachi-e (立ち絵) in Japanese.
name: Sprites

description: The game with this tag features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cannibalism]cannibalism[/url] in some form.
name: Cannibalism

description: One (or more) of the game's heroines is extremely [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luck]lucky[/url], extremely unlucky, or possibly both at the same time.
name: Extremely (un)Lucky Heroine

description: A significant part of the game is set in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onsen]onsen[/url].
name: Onsen

description: This game has one or multiple [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pig]pigs[/url] taking an important role in the story. Or it has pigs all around on many scenes with multiple lines of dialogs related to them.
name: Pigs

description: This meta-tag is for gathering all tags related to the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Save_game]save game[/url] methods games utilize.
name: Game Saving Method

description: This game always saves data to the same file, usually at fixed points in the story (a process known as [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autosave]Autosave[/url]). The player is not able to keep multiple saves at different points in the game, so if they wish to see the results of making a different choice they will often need to restart the game from the beginning.
name: Autosave Only

description: The game takes place in some form of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Underworld]underworld[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hell]hell[/url], an abode of demons and/or the souls of the damned. It may correspond to the underworld of some specific mythology, or it may just be a generic hell.
name: Underworld

description: A heroine of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawyer]Lawyer[/url].
name: Lawyer Heroine

description: This game has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secret_society]secret society[/url] moving in the background.
name: Secret Society

description: This game has a group of friends, that consider their group as an entity (with a name, hideout etc.), that usually includes the protagonist as well.
name: Group of Friends

description: A heroine in this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientist]scientist[/url]. She can be working in a scientific field, holding a position in a university, research center or scientific laboratory.
name: Scientist Heroine

description: The game features one or more heroines wearing a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monocle]monocle[/url] for the most part of the game.
name: Heroine with Monocle

description: Protagonist of this story is a driver of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_racing_forms#Motor_racing]motor racing[/url].
name: Race Driver Protagonist

description: A heroine of this story is a driver of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_racing_forms#Motor_racing]motor racing[/url].
name: Race Driver Heroine

description:
This game's sprites conforms and expounds upon the modern minimalism movement.

Minimalism describes movements in various forms of art and design, especially visual art and music, where the work is stripped down to its most fundamental features.

See the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minimalism]Wikipedia[/url] article for details.
name: Minimalist Sprites

description: One ore more characters in the story suffer from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insomnia]insomnia[/url].
name: Insomnia

description:
Protagonist is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orphan]orphan[/url].

An orphan is a child permanently bereaved of or abandoned by his or her parents. In common usage, only a child (or the young of an animal) who has lost both parents is called an orphan. However, adults can also be referred to as orphans, or "adult orphans".
name: Orphan Protagonist

description: The game has many scenes set in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison]prison[/url].
name: Prison

description: Protagonist of this story is currently or a former member of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_family]royal family[/url].
name: Royal Protagonist

description:
Similar to its parent-tag with the exception that these powering-up situations occur multiple times in a single combat.

Battles/conflicts in the game tend to be solved, rather than by skill, wit, equipment or pre-existing factors, by willpower or such, allowing characters to pass their limits as many times higher and higher as the situation requires.
A mortal blow is not the end, it's a chance to power up to infinity. Typically anger and proximity (or actuality) of death only strengthen the characters, allowing them to draw out unfathomable power.
Battles employing this plot device can typically always end either way, since there are objectively virtually no restrictions on the number of times you can power up with yet another attack more powerful than the last one you took.

For example:
As the hero gets beaten by the story's archvillain, he remembers a move his kung fu master taught him and uses it to take down his adversary.
The archvillain, baffled by this situation, gets angrier and turns into a demon which in turn beats down the hero.
Hero gets a sudden blessing from his dead-childhood-friend-turn-angel and blasts the demon with holy fire.
In response to that the demon-archvillain grabs a mecha, that was conveniently lying where he fell (or summons one out of thin air), and fuses with it to become an archvillain-demon-mecha and disintegrates the hero with laser beams.
Following this the hero has a long scene about his past, friends, family, etc., which somehow renews his will and rouses him back from the dead as a super-human-angel-blessed-kung-fu guy and...

In short something like this good old [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=16uevTBhgV4&feature=related]metallic knights[/url] movie.
name: Infinite Spontaneous Power-ups

description:
This kind of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plot_device]plot device[/url] shows itself in stories where the characters suddenly reveal hidden powers, strategies and techniques (moves) to save themselves from a pinch, no matter how severe the situation is.

They either spontaneously invent these new strategies and techniques (moves) OR somehow suddenly acquire new powers OR remember things that they learned/found earlier, which rarely gets even mentioned before, etc. Examples are as many as shounen style stories go...
name: Spontaneous Power-ups

Once insertion is complete, the fingers either naturally clench into a fist or remain straight. In more vigorous forms of fisting, such as "punching," a fully clenched fist may be inserted and withdrawn slowly. Fisting may be performed with or without a partner, and is enjoyed by people of all sexual orientations.

Sometimes also used when referring to half-Japanese people, though not technically correct.

Surrealist works feature the element of surprise, unexpected juxtapositions and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non_sequitur_%28humor%29]non sequitur[/url]; however, many Surrealist artists and writers regard their work as an expression of the philosophical movement first and foremost, with the works being an artefact.

In some cases, available choices may appear or disappear as the timer ticks down, or the time remaining when a choice is selected may influence the result.

description:
This game has considerable amount of scenes where heroines are shown wearing [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panties]panties[/url].

Panties are a form of underwear designed to be worn by women and children in the crotch area below the waist. Typical components include an elastic waistband, a crotch panel to cover the genital area (usually lined with absorbent material such as cotton), a pair of leg openings which, like the waistband, are often made of elastic, and constructed with material that is breathable. Whilst panties were originally designed to cover the entire lower half of the female form, the modern version (since the 1970s) has either no legs or, in some cases, very short ones, and has become progressively more revealing over time.

Do not use this trait related to sex scenes where a character's undergarment is briefly shown. Use it on occasions where characters are displaying their undergarments occasionally either because of their other clothing are designed in a way that it reveals them or when they don't wear anything else to cover their undergarments.
name: Heroine with Visible Panties

An alien.
A time traveler from the past or future.
A person from another dimension.

Note that this doesn't necessarily make a heroine evil or a traitor. Do not use this tag for disguising characters like spies, assassins and stuff.

People who like to read more of their games but prefer to avoid disturbing bad ends can find these endings satisfactory as well.

Do not use this tag for every game that has a non-violent bad ending, but for the ones that has new bits of reading in them.

These endings are brief, sometimes accompanied with disturbing scenes that can be considered as a form of punishment, like scenes of gory deaths of games characters or sexual assaults and such.

They don't really carry much story value, unless you are into these types of scenes, and avoiding them wouldn't cause the player miss important parts of a story.

This also means that the protagonist won't be clueless about relationships like a kid encountering his/her first romance.

Having an Osananajimi that's head over heels in love with the protag, waking him up, cooking for him and hanging out with him at all times do not count. Since for the industry standard Donkan protagonists, she doesn't really exist.

description:
In this type of story, a disembodied narrator describes what the characters do and what happens to them. You don’t see directly through a character’s eyes as you do in a first-person narrative, but often the narrator describes the main character’s thoughts and feelings about what’s going on.

A third-person narrator can sometimes be omniscient, when they have a bird's-eye-view of all the goings on. Or they can be limited, and stick closely to the perspectives of just one or two characters.

In this narrative style all characters are referred to as he, she, or they, rather than any character using “I” or “we” in the narration.
name: Third-person Narrative

description:
The game contains at least one scene that features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handjob]handjob[/url].

A handjob is a slang or informal word denoting the manual stimulation of one partner's penis by another partner, whether female or male, usually to the point of orgasm and ejaculation. What differentiates it from fellatio is the exclusive use of hands, rather than the mouth or a combination of hands and mouth, to rub the penis.

By contrast, the manual stimulation of a female's sex organ is usually called fingering due to the use of fingers in stimulation of the clitoris and vulva.

aliases: Leader of the Student Council Heroine
President of the Student Government Heroine
description:
A heroine is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student-body_president]student government president[/url].

The President of the Student Government is the highest ranking officer of a student government or student union association on the high school, college, or university level. Respected as one of the highest honored roles to achieve during academic studies, serving as President can enable a student to gain strong interpersonal, leadership, social, economic, and management skills. Employers may look highly upon an applicant who has served in this capacity.

A Student Government President is different from a Class President. Class presidents only represent a specific class (grade) of students, while the body president is the highest ranking student in the school.
name: Student Council President Heroine

description:
Protagonist is the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student-body_president]student government president[/url].

The President of the Student Government is the highest ranking officer of a student government or student union association on the high school, college, or university level. Respected as one of the highest honored roles to achieve during academic studies, serving as President can enable a student to gain strong interpersonal, leadership, social, economic, and management skills. Employers may look highly upon an applicant who has served in this capacity.

A Student Government President is different from a Class President. Class presidents only represent a specific class (grade) of students, while the body president is the highest ranking student in the school.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities (such as ears or tails).
name: Kemonomimi Hero

description: The game's story features elements of mind control, [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypnotism]hypnotism[/url] and [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainwashing]brainwashing[/url].
name: Mind Control

description: This game features battles fought in the space with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starship]starships[/url].
name: Starship Combat

description:
This game features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url] scenes that can be avoided by making right choices or succeeding in gameplay stages.

The tag has been made unapplicable in favour of its child tags. Please use more specific tags, and in the situations where you are not sure which tag to use (for example, because you haven't finished the game), use the generic [url=/g84]Rape[/url] tag instead.
name: Avoidable Rape

description:
You can see every "proper ending" of the game without experiencing any rape scenes of a heroine. Their only rape scenes are reserved for premature bad endings, which you are not forced to read to access the other endings.

Does not apply to non-heroine characters.
name: Completely Avoidable Heroine Rape

description:
The protagonist is a personification/embodiment of a cosmic object (star, planet, etc.).

See the Wikipedia entry for [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celestial_body]celestial body[/url] for more details.
name: Celestial Body Protagonist

description:
This game features scenes of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torture]torture[/url].

These scenes are not required to be graphically depicted.

Aim of the tag is to mark the presence of scenes of severe pain or suffering, whether physical or mental, being intentionally inflicted on people are present in this game somewhere.
name: Torture

description: The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Style_%28visual_arts%29]graphic style[/url] of the visual novel changes noticeably one or more times during gameplay. This might represent a character's personality change, an altered state of consciousness, a change of location, a flashback, etc.
name: Graphic Style Change

description: A significant part of the game is set in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theater]theater[/url].
name: Theater

description: A significant part of the game is set in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_theatre]musical theater[/url].
name: Musical Theater

description:
This story takes place at a time between years 1920-1929 on Earth.

More details on 20's can be found on the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1920s]Wikipedia[/url] article.
name: 20's

description: These games contain sexual scenes between a blood-related mother and daughter.
name: Blood-related Mother/Daughter Incest

description: Protagonist in this VN works as a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary]secretary[/url].
name: Secretary Protagonist

description: The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farmer]farmer[/url].
name: Farmer Protagonist

description: Protagonist of the game is the child of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demon[/url] and a human or something similar.
name: Half-demon Protagonist

description:
The protagonist of this game is born from the union of a human and a member of different species.

Examples include [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half-elves]half-elves[/url], half-demons, [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demigod]demigods[/url] etc...

Magically or scientifically created combinations count for this tag, but cyborgs etc do not.
name: Half-human Protagonist

description: This game's protagonist belongs to the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divinity]divinity[/url].
name: Divine Protagonist

description: Protagonist is [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenreSavvy]genre savvy[/url], meaning he compares his situation to that of a movie/book/video game/visual novel hero and draws conclusions from that.
name: Genre Savvy Protagonist

description:
This visual novel mixes elements of both science fiction and fantasy (for example magic wielding robots).

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science_Fantasy]Science fantasy[/url] is a mixed genre within speculative fiction drawing elements from both science fiction and fantasy.
name: Science Fantasy

description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rebellion]Rebellion[/url] against government plays a huge role in this visual novel.

This tag is supposed to be only used only for political rebellions and not to describe a rebellious attitude of characters.
name: Rebellion

description: Protagonist is an overlord. He leads an Army of Darkness to conquer the whole known universe (or something similar).
name: Overlord Protagonist

description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government]Government[/url] plays an important part in this story.
name: Government

description: The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knight]knight[/url].
name: Knight Protagonist

description:
This story takes place at a time between years 1950-1959 on Earth.

More details on [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50's]50's[/url] can be found on wikipedia.
name: 50's

description:
Denpa games are a subgenre of horror eroge, popularised by the 1996 Leaf game 'Shizuku' which also lent the genre its name. The typical model is a horror story where the catalyst for the events that occur are based on familiar people acting in unfamiliar, yet seemingly orchestrated ways. Stories where the world seems to have gone mad; and the protagonist is not necessarily an exception. The name comes from the idea that electromagnetic waves (denpa) is causing people to act strangely (although it is rarely anything that mundane).

Description from a [url=http://www.menhelmate.org/2010/04/subarashiki-hibi-furenzoku-sonzai.html]Subarashiki Hibi[/url] review by Asceai.
name: Denpa

description:
This game has at least one heroine with a hairstyle covering one (or both) of her eyes for a considerable part of the story.

Also used for heroines with their face hidden by shadows in a similar manner.
name: Heroine with Eye Covering Hairstyle

description: One or more of the heroines in this game uses the "ore" [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronoun]Japanese pronoun[/url] to address herself.
name: Orekko Heroine

description: Large parts of this game are set in the Wonderland of Lewis Carroll's book [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland]Alice's Adventures in Wonderland[/url]. Animals and inanimate objects will usually have voices and personalities, and the characters will very often mirror the famous characters of Carroll's original book and its sequel.
name: Wonderland

description:
Bad endings in this game (occasionally also good endings) are followed by a short scene in which characters explain to the player where they went wrong and how they can get a better ending next time.

(At least, that's the intention. In many games the actual advice is somewhere between useless and nonexistent, and the characters crack jokes instead. No-one seems to mind.)
name: Hint Corner

description:
The game contains scenes that features a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blowjob]blowjob[/url] performed by two people together at the same time on a single person.

[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/27/130927.jpg]NSFW Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/28/130928.jpg]NSFW Example 2[/url]
name: Twin Blowjob

description:
This game features one or more heroines with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wing]wings[/url]. 

She can be an angel, demon or even ordinary human wearing an accessory, but there are many scenes where she has wings on her back.
name: Heroine with Wings

description:
This type of protagonist is popular from the beginning of the game or becomes one shortly after. Opposed to the usual VN protagonist that becomes popular at the end of the game.

Having a few childhood friends, or a group of friends doesn't count.

Check the Wikipedia entry on [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popularity]popularity[/url] for details.
name: Popular Protagonist

description:
The protagonist of this story is, or becomes, the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_%28nautical%29]captain[/url]/commanding officer of a ship/spaceship/submarine.

You can also use this tag for the military rank for the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_%28naval%29]naval captains[/url], since it's almost the same thing. But do not use it for the military rank for [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_%28land%29]captain (land)[/url] that doesn't have anything to do with ships.
name: Captain Protagonist

description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pirate]Pirates[/url] play an important role in this story.
name: Pirates

description: One or more heroines in this story are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pirate]pirates[/url].
name: Pirate Heroine

description: The protagonist of this story is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pirate]pirate[/url].
name: Pirate Protagonist

description: Some part of this story takes place in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slums]slums[/url]. Poverty and difficult living conditions are depicted in the story.
name: Slums

description: One or more of the heroes in this game are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adult]adults[/url].
name: Adult Hero

description: This game features a heroine suffering from androphobia - an exaggerated or irrational fear of men.
name: Androphobic Heroine

description: Sexual scenes in this VN are unusually short. Although there can be many CG's per scene and/or many scenes in general but each scene is short and ends very fast.
name: Short Sexual Scenes

description: Sexual scenes in this VN are unusually long. Walls of text per scene are expected (multiple ejaculations optional but quite common).
name: Long Sexual Scenes

description:
Stories involving the impregnation of one of the characters. Usually found in the games about the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fertilisation]fertilisation[/url] fetish.

Do not use for games that you suddenly see a heroine pregnant without the impregnation taking a role in the story itself. This tag is for the act of impregnation, not pregnancy.
name: Impregnation

description: A heroine's appearance in this game resembles to an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albino]albino[/url]; she has white hair, and her eyes have unnatural color (like red or almost transparent blue).
name: Albino Heroine

description:
The protagonist of the game can [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death]die[/url] in one of the routes or endings.

Do not use if this results in a game over/bad end.
name: Death of Protagonist

description:
The time frame of the events is substantial and meaningful for the plot. By the end of the story reader should truly feel a significant passage of time in the world. This should mean at least years or even centuries passing and characters or the world changing over time.

This tag is not meant for brief leaps in time or time leaps taking place after the real events in the game's epilogue or such.
name: Passage of Time

description: At least one of this game's heroines portraits a person from the real world.
name: Heroine Based on Real Person

description: This heroine's use of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansai_accent]Kansai dialect[/url], most commonly Kyoto or Osaka dialect, makes her stand out. In keeping with Japanese stereotypes about people from this region, she will usually have a brash personality to match.
name: Heroine With Kansai Accent

description:
One or more heroines of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priest]priestess[/url].

Do not mix with [url=http://vndb.org/g115]Miko Heroine[/url].
name: Priestess Heroine

description:
A character's breasts produce milk during the act of sex.

Refer to the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_lactation]Wikipedia[/url] article for details.
name: Lactation During Sex

description: This game contains one or more scenes of rape with amorphous/gelatinous monster.
name: Slime Monster Rape

description: This game features sex scenes involving non-human, non-animal fictional creatures.
name: Sex With Monsters

description: This game features consensual sex involving a amorphous/gelatinous monster.
name: Consensual Sex Involving Slime Monsters

description: The game is set in a former all-girls school, where the boy-girl ratio is very low, and protagonist might be the only boy in all-girls class.
name: Former All-girls School

description: This game has built-in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walkthrough#Video_games]walkthrough[/url]/flowchart, which can be accessed through in-game menus.
name: Built-in Flowchart

description:
These games contain scenes of incest that lead to impregnation.

See [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inbreeding]inbreeding[/url] on Wikipedia for details.
name: Inbreeding

description: One of the game's support characters is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maid]maid[/url].
name: Maid Support Character

description:
The game is set in a place based on or borrowing aspects from the Middle Ages, but has distinctly fictional elements such as fictional kingdoms or magic.

These games often feature princesses, knights, castles and magic.

See the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medieval_fantasy]Wikipedia[/url] entry for details.
name: Medieval Fantasy

description: The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magical_girl]magical girl[/url] (or in some cases, a magical cross-dressing boy).
name: Mahou Shoujo Protagonist

description: This game has one or multiple [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monster]monsters[/url] taking an important role in the story. Or it has monsters all around on many scenes with multiple lines of dialogs related to them.
name: Monsters

description: Some characters in this game are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crossdressing]cross-dressing[/url].
name: Cross-dressing

description: Protagonist in this game has one or more [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imaginary_friends]imaginary friends[/url].
name: Protagonist with Imaginary Friends

description:
During the story protagonist tries to commit a suicide (if he succeeds or not is irrelevant).

Check related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_crisis]Wikipedia[/url] article for details.
name: Suicidal Protagonist

description:
One or more heroines of this game are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y%C5%8Dkai]Youkai[/url].

Youkai range eclectically from the malevolent to the mischievous, or occasionally bring good fortune to those who encounter them. Often they possess animal features (such as the Kappa, which is similar to a turtle, or the Tengu which has wings), other times they can appear mostly human, some look like inanimate objects and others have no discernible shape. Youkai usually have a spiritual supernatural power, with shapeshifting being one of the most common. Youkai that have the ability to shapeshift are called obake.
name: Youkai Heroine

description:
A hero in this game can [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death]die[/url] in one of the routes or endings.

Do not use if this results in a game over/bad end, and for games that the death of a hero is 'nothing big' nor a reason for any drama like Rance series.
name: Death of Hero

description: A heroine in this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuki-onna]yuki-onna[/url], the semi-spirit entity which controls ice, cold weather or just can freeze everything.
name: Yuki-onna Heroine

description: In games with this tag a significant portion of character sprites are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silhouette]silhouettes[/url].
name: Silhouettes

description:
External attributes of the VN (such as it being a work of fiction, or a computer program, or a 2D representation on a screen, or being influenced by a player, etc.) are themselves relevant to the plot of the VN. This may range from just regularly breaking the fourth wall to more subtle plot constructions.

Check the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org./wiki/Metafiction]Wikipedia[/url] article for details.
name: Metafiction

description: The game displays the in-story date and/or time on the screen, always or at least regularly. Often this is in the form of a small overlay in a corner of the screen.
name: Date Display

description: This visual novel has many scenes set on board of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship]sea-ship[/url].
name: Ship

description:
One or more heroines in this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mermaid]mermaid[/url].

A mermaid is a mythological aquatic creature with a female human head and torso and the tail of a fish. Mermaids have a broad representation in folklore, literature, and popular culture.
name: Mermaid Heroine

description:
This game features elements and themes from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairy_tale]fairy tales[/url].

Only a small number of the stories thus designated explicitly refer to fairies. Nonetheless, the stories may be distinguished from other folk narratives such as legends and traditions (which generally involve belief in the veracity of the events described) and explicitly moral tales, including beast fables. Fairy tales typically feature such folkloric characters as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, giants or gnomes, and usually magic or enchantments.
name: Fairy Tale

description: One of the heroes is the director of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student_club]student club[/url].
name: Student Club President Hero

description: Traditional [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_mythology]Japanese mythology[/url] strongly influences the setting and events in this VN.
name: Japanese Mythology

description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celtic_mythology]Celtic mythology[/url] strongly influences the setting and events in this VN.
name: Celtic Mythology

description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddhist_mythology]Buddhist mythology[/url] strongly influences the setting and events in this VN.
name: Buddhist Mythology

description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germanic_paganism]Germanic mythology[/url] strongly influences the setting and events in this VN.
name: Germanic Mythology

description:
There are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elves]elves[/url] in this story.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elves_in_fantasy_fiction_and_games]fantasy fiction kind of elves[/url], not the fairies.
name: Elves

description: In this story, all characters that protagonist had intercourse with will definitely compose his [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harem]harem[/url] in the end.
name: Unavoidable Harem Ending

description:
This game uses a lot of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_effects]special effects[/url] to enhance the storytelling, making the game look like it is animated during some scenes.

These games may also use animated scenes and looping animations but these are not related to this tag.
name: High Amount of Special Effects

description: The sport of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennis]tennis[/url] plays a major role in this VN.
name: Tennis

description:
This visual novel contains a scene that features a blowjob being performed by three characters together on a single penis.

[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/40/130940.jpg]NSFW Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/41/130941.jpg]NSFW Example 2[/url]
name: Triple Blowjob

description: One of this games hero is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artist]artist[/url].
name: Artist Hero

description: One of the heroes of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musician]musician[/url].
name: Musician Hero

description: Game contains a high amount of choices.  In many cases, you won't be able to play for more than five minutes without seeing a new choice.
name: Lots of Choices

description: Game contains scenes of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Castration]castration[/url].  This can be either story-related or for fetish reasons.
name: Castration

description: One or more heroes in this game are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vocalist]vocalists[/url].
name: Singer Hero

description: At least one hero of these games is (or was) a professional [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier]soldier[/url].
name: Soldier Hero

description: One ore more of the heroes is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence]artificial intelligence[/url].
name: AI Hero

description: The protagonist is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence]artificial intelligence[/url].
name: AI Protagonist

description: One or more heroines is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineer]engineer[/url].
name: Engineer Heroine

description: One or more heroines of the game bearing this tag is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frotteurism]frotteur[/url].
name: Chikan Heroine

description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronomy]Astronomy[/url] club and the activities related to it takes an important role in this story.
name: Astronomy Club

description: There is a hero who wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glasses]glasses[/url].
name: Hero with Glasses

description: The protagonist is extremely [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luck]lucky[/url], extremely unlucky, or possibly both at the same time.
name: Extremely (un)Lucky Protagonist

description:
One of the heroines is the most senior teacher and the leader of a school.

See related Wikipedia entries [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal_%28school%29]1[/url] & [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal_%28academia%29]2[/url].
name: Principal Heroine

description: One of the heroes is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Private_detective]private detective[/url].
name: Private Detective Hero

description:
The game with this tag has at least one heroine who's [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divorce]divorced from a past marriage[/url]. Not to be confused with [url=http://vndb.org/g549]Widow heroine[/url] though.
It also applies if she's divorced from the protagonist himself, like in [url=http://vndb.org/v415]Sekai de Ichiban Dame na Koi[/url]'s case.
name: Divorcee Heroine

description: A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demonic_possession]demonic possession[/url] or a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spirit_possession]spirit possession[/url] is portrayed in this visual novel.
name: Possession

description: This game features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Succubi]succubi[/url].
name: Succubi

description: The protagonist of this VN is from a noble family, a member of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobility]nobility[/url].
name: Noble Protagonist

description: The protagonist in this VN is of a sea dwelling race, a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merperson_%28disambiguation%29]merperson[/url].
name: Merprotagonist

description: This game features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incubi]incubi[/url].
name: Incubi

description:
The protagonist of this visual novel is a girl whose physical features make her look like a boy to the point that she could be mistaken for one.
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross_dressing]Cross-dressing[/url] is not required while often being the source of the confusion.
name: Reverse Trap Protagonist

description: Some part of the game takes place in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junior_High_School]middle school[/url].
name: Middle School

description: A heroine in this VN is a devoted believer of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religion]religion[/url] and she keeps talking about it frequently.
name: Religious Heroine

description: One of this games heroines is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seiyuu]seiyuu[/url].
name: Seiyuu Heroine

description:
These games are, for the most part, about a journey.

It may be about a road trip, a travel with friends and family. (g286)

Or an epic journey like [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odyssey]Odyssey[/url], something about a ring and a volcano, a voyage across the stars or maybe even dimensions. (g363)

Or it may be about a journey not fitting to either of these two, like a voyage from Beijing to Berlin, in that case use this tag itself.
name: Journey

description:
The protagonist's parents were closely related to each other, genetically.

Check the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inbred]Wikipedia[/url] page for details.
name: Inbred Protagonist

description: One of the villain of the game is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idiot]idiot[/url]. Usually serves as a comedy factor.
name: Foolish Villain

description:
A game tagged with this tag has at least one heroine, who for the majority of the game possesses an [url=http://animanga.wikia.com/wiki/Ahoge]ahoge[/url]. Ahoge refers to a single, often large, lock of hair sticking out from the top of the head.
Prime examples would include Saber from Fate/Stay Night, or Sumika from the Muv-Luv saga.
name: Heroine with Ahoge

description: One of the support characters in the game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mad_scientist]mad scientist[/url].
name: Mad Scientist Support Character

description: Stories involving [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resurrection]resurrection[/url].
name: Resurrection

description:
The story is set in a world already created by some other author. Majority of those works are free dojin novels.

Check the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fan-fiction]Wikipedia[/url] article for details.

Unofficial faithful adaptations should use [url=/g3740]Adaptation[/url] or its child tags instead.
name: Fan-fiction

description: A game tagged with this tag has a protagonist, who for the majority of the game possesses an [url=http://animanga.wikia.com/wiki/Ahoge]ahoge[/url]. Ahoge refers to a single, often large, lock of hair sticking out from the top of the head.
name: Protagonist with Ahoge

description:
The story of this game does not have clear cut, conclusive and definitive ending(s). There will be many questions unanswered and outcome of certain events will never be explained.

Severity of the mystery may change from a few details unexplained to stories which leave you wondering where the next chapter is.

This type of story-telling leaves the answer to those questions and outcome of the story to the imagination of the readers.

Only use on games with an ending that is open to interpretation.
name: Open Ending(s)

description: A game tagged with this tag has a hero who for the majority of the game possesses an ahoge. Ahoge refers to a single, often large, lock of hair sticking out from the top of the head.
name: Hero with Ahoge

description: A game tagged with this tag has a side character who for the majority of the game possesses an ahoge. Ahoge refers to a single, often large, lock of hair sticking out from the top of the head.
name: Support Character with Ahoge

description: A Hero of this game is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bald]bald[/url].
name: Bald Hero

description: The protagonist of this game is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bald]bald[/url].
name: Bald Protagonist

description: A heroine of this game is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bald]bald[/url].
name: Bald Heroine

description:
Heroines featuring the distinctive '[url=https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairIntakes]intake[/url]' hairstyle, where the rising forelock (usually divided in the middle) makes the hair look like an hood scoop.

Prime examples can be found in [url=http://vndb.org/v4]Clannad[/url]'s Kyou as well as in the cast of [url=http://vndb.org/v92]Muv Luv Alternative[/url].
name: Heroine with Intake Hairstyle

description: This game features a heroine whose hair is rendered in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_gradient]color gradient[/url] for stylistic purposes.
name: Heroine with Gradient Colored Hair

description: This is a meta tag to gather all tags regarding the hair (generally the hairstyle) of heroines.
name: Heroine's Hair

description: This is a meta tag to gather all tags regarding the body type, proportions and skin colors of heroines.
name: Heroine's Body

description: One of the heroes in this game has a profession of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teacher]teacher[/url].
name: Teacher Hero

description: A hero of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloning]clone[/url].
name: Clone Hero

description:
This story features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloning]cloning[/url].

Cloning in biology is the process of producing similar populations of genetically identical individuals that occurs in nature when organisms such as bacteria, insects or plants reproduce asexually.
name: Cloning

description: Considerable part of this story features an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unrequited_love]unrequited love[/url], a love that is not reciprocated or returned in kind.
name: Unrequited Love

description:

description:

Anal–oral sex, also referred to or described as anal–oral contact or anilingus (from anus + lingus (Latin Lingere: to lick, less commonly spelled analingus), is a form of oral sex involving contact between the anus or perineum of one person and the mouth (lips) or tongue of another.
name: Anilingus

description:

It is similar to boobjob and does not include any anal or vaginal penetration by itself.

description:
This game features a heroine that gets her breast size increased in a very short period of time. This can be the result of a realistic medical procedure like [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breast_implant]breast implants[/url], or of fantasy origin like some super drugs or magic.

If the breasts are expanded to the impossible, grotesque size, use g1561 instead.
name: Breast Expansion

description:
The game contains at least one scene that features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-penetrative_sex]Non-penetrative sex[/url].

Non-penetrative sex is sexual activity without vaginal, anal, or oral penetration, as opposed to penetrative aspects of intercourse, anal sex, or oral sex.
name: Non-penetrative Sex

description:
This game features one or more scenes of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tribadism]tribadism[/url].

Tribadism is a form of non-penetrative sex in which a woman rubs her vulva against her partner's body for sexual stimulation. This may involve female-to-female genital contact or a female rubbing her vulva against her partner's thigh, arm, palm or stomach, and does not always reflect a scissoring motion.
name: Tribadism

description:
One or more heroines in this game is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villainous]villainous[/url], or simply is an "evil" character of the story.

Starting bad or going bad later, then becoming good again etc. doesn't matter as long as the villainous part takes an important role in the story.

Examples include [url=http://vndb.org/v1494]Miss Leet[/url].
name: Villainous Heroine

description:
The protagonist of the game is (or was) a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercenary]mercenary[/url].

A mercenary is a person who takes part in an armed conflict, who is not a national or a party to the conflict, and is "motivated to take part in the hostilities essentially by the desire for private gain and, in fact, is promised, by or on behalf of a party to the conflict, material compensation substantially in excess of that promised or paid to combatants of similar ranks and functions in the armed forces of that Party".
name: Mercenary Protagonist

description:
At least one heroine of these games is (or was) a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercenary]mercenary[/url].

A mercenary is a person who takes part in an armed conflict, who is not a national or a party to the conflict, and is "motivated to take part in the hostilities essentially by the desire for private gain and, in fact, is promised, by or on behalf of a party to the conflict, material compensation substantially in excess of that promised or paid to combatants of similar ranks and functions in the armed forces of that Party".
name: Mercenary Heroine

description: One of the side characters in the game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nun]nun[/url].
name: Nun Support Character

description: These visual novels have no background music, and might not have any sound at all.

description:
All tags related to the audible presentation goes under this meta-tag.

Check the related [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_music]Wikipedia[/url] article for details.
name: Sounds and Music

description: Tags concerning how the story is presented to the reader are collected here. This meta-tag is not about the story, but what kinds of methods and tools are used to present it.
name: Story

description: This meta-tag is to cover the tags concerning the various displays games use.
name: Displays

description: Protagonist of this game is poor. He (or she) is either working to earn a living or suffering from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty]poverty[/url].

description:
This game has only bad endings. The type of the game may vary, but when you reach to the end of the story, it won't end with a happy ending, no matter what you try.
This tag is not suitable to vns with bittersweet endings.
name: Only Bad Endings

description: One of the heroes of the VN is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampire]vampire[/url].
name: Vampire Hero

description: This game has heroes that are [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twins]twins[/url].
name: Twin Brothers as Heroes

description:
This game features one or more scenes featuring [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BDSM]BDSM[/url].

BDSM is a type of roleplay or lifestyle choice between two or more individuals who use their experiences of pain and power to create sexual tension, pleasure, and release. The compound acronym, BDSM, is derived from the terms bondage and discipline (B&D, B/D, or BD), dominance and submission (D&s, D/s, or Ds), sadism and masochism (S&M, S/M, or SM).
name: BDSM

description: One or more heroes of this VN is from a noble family, a member of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobility]nobility[/url].
name: Noble Hero

description: A hero of this game is (or was) an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassin]assassin[/url].
name: Assassin Hero

description: These games have at least one hero who is a mage. Unlike the [url=http://vndb.org/g238]Battlemage Heroine[/url] tag this spellcaster do not use his magic in combat.
name: Mage Hero

description:
One or more of the heroes in this game displays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandere#Y]yandere[/url] behavior.

Yandere is a Japanese term for a person who is initially very loving and gentle to someone before their devotion becomes destructive in nature, often through violence.
name: Yandere Hero

description:
The sexual scenes in this game features a gameplay of sorts.

It can either be in the form of a lot of choices made during these scenes with different paths and results. Or it may give players the ability to interact with the participants of these scenes by using mouse and keyboard to touch, drag and drop objects and such.
name: Sexual Scenes with Gameplay

description:
A hero of this game is a Maou, a demon king (or king of devils etc).

He might've just escaped from being sealed for centuries and aiming to regain his former power (and enslave those who thwarted him the last time), just finally decided on taking over the world... or he might be a Maou who loves small animals and nature in general, hates mankind because they pollute it, and who ends up living together with a group of humans to see if they're really that bad.

Do note that this tag is only intended for actual demon kings,  and not for characters bearing Maou as a title or a nick. The character needs to have fantastic, [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demonic]demonic[/url] properties.
name: Maou Hero

description:
This game features one or more heroes that display [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsundere]tsundere[/url] behavior.

Tsundere is a Japanese character development process which describes a person who is initially cold and even hostile towards another person before gradually showing their warm side over time.
name: Tsundere Hero

description:
One or more heroes in this game is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villainous]villainous[/url], or simply is an "evil" character of the story.

Starting bad or going bad later, then becoming good again etc. doesn't matter as long as the villainous part takes an important role in the story.
name: Villainous Hero

description: This meta-tag is to gather heroine traits related to their personalities.
name: Heroes by Personality

description: One (or more) of the game's heroines has no sense of direction.
name: No Sense of Direction Heroine

description: The protagonist of this game portraits a person from the real world.
name: Protagonist Based on Real Person

description: Some kind of sacred treasure or treasures (Holy Grail, holy sword, etc.) take an important role in the story.
name: Sacred Treasure

description: Games that have people using two swords at the same time.

description:

description:
One of the heroines in this story is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Writer]writer[/url], be it of fiction, magazine articles, or whatever else.

Can also be used for newspaper reporters who write articles as well.

description:
One or more of the heroes is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werewolf]werewolf[/url].

A werewolf, also known as a lycanthrope, is a mythological or folkloric human with the ability to shapeshift into an anthropomorphic wolf-like creature, either purposely, by being bitten by another werewolf, or after being placed under a curse.
name: Werewolf Hero

description: This game features combat scenes involving the use of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arquebus]arquebus[/url].

description: This game features scenes where one or more of the game's heroines appear wearing an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apron]apron[/url] and nothing else.

description:
One or multiple heroines in the game wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qipao]Cheongsam[/url].

The cheongsam is a body-hugging (modified in Shanghai) one-piece Chinese dress for women; the male version is the changshan. It is known in Mandarin Chinese as the qípáo.
name: Heroine with Chinese Dress

description:
The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werewolf]werewolf[/url].

A werewolf, also known as a lycanthrope, is a mythological or folkloric human with the ability to shapeshift into an anthropomorphic wolf-like creature, either purposely, by being bitten by another werewolf, or after being placed under a curse.
name: Werewolf Protagonist

name: Protagonist's Boss as a Heroine

description:
In these games, the player is allowed a choice to let the participants to keep their clothing on or to have them get naked, during most of the sexual scenes. This means that there are two variations to every CG for these scenes to collect.

Note not to confuse with [url=/g2422]Nude Filter[/url], which is a gag option to remove the clothes from the character sprites at any given time.
name: Clothing ON/OFF

description:
Features scenes where characters enact in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paraphilic_infantilism]paraphilic infantilism[/url].

Paraphilic infantilism is a sexual fetish for some that involves role-playing a regression to an infant-like state. Behaviors may include drinking from a baby bottle or wearing diapers.
name: Paraphilic Infantilism

description:
Large parts of this game take place in modern day [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_of_America]United States of America[/url].
Note: "Modern day" refers to an unspecified time period between the late 20th century and today.
name: Modern Day United States of America

description: This game features a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_defense]Tower Defense[/url] gameplay element.  This involves placing units and/or structures on a map in order to defeat waves of enemies.
name: Tower Defense

description:
The protagonist of this game has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kemonomimi#Animals]kemonomimi[/url].

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities (such as ears or tails).
name: Kemonomimi Protagonist

description: A hero in this VN is a devoted believer of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religion]religion[/url] and he keeps talking about it frequently.

description: A hero in this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientist]scientist[/url]. He can be working in a scientific field, holding a position in a university, research center or scientific laboratory.

description:
For games featuring heroines with doglike ears or anything that would remind it as their signature part or appearance, such as a hairband with dog ears or her hair being shaped exactly like one.

Please do not mix with doggirl tag; almost every doggirl has inumimi, but not every inumimi is a doggirl... And doggirl is a child tag of Non-human Heroine, so it's not suitable for human girls with inumimi.

description:
This game features [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosophy]philosophical[/url] themes and/or lengthy philosophical discussions.

Philosophy is the study of general and fundamental problems, such as those connected with existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language.

description:
These games revolve around a group of characters working to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design]design[/url] something or such an act takes a huge part in the story.

They may be working to design (create) doujin comics, games and such or may be employed in a company that works in such a field.

Do not use for games about music and food related projects, since there are already tags for those.
name: Design Story

description: The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=salesman]salesman[/url].
name: Salesman Protagonist

Protagonist's Wife's Sister as a Heroine
description:
One or more of the heroines is the protagonist's [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sister-in-law]sister-in-law[/url].
Sister-in-law refers to the sister of protagonist's wife, or the wife of protagonist's brother.
In rare instances it may also define the relationship between people who marry siblings and refer to the wife of protagonist's spouse's sibling.
name: Protagonist's Sister-in-Law as a Heroine

description: One of this games heroines is protagonist's [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daughter]daughter[/url].
name: Protagonist's Daughter as a Heroine

description:
